Description: Rectangular, almost square, axe-head: with slightly convex sides, roughly made. The butt is uneven and one of the sides is longer than the other. The blade is thickly corroded, especially at the cutting edge, which appears originally to have been very slightly convex with rounded corners. The metal is considerably pitted, particularly around the peripheries of the tool.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Osiris-Khentimentu (Abydos), Temenos Level 53
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' I (London, 1902), 23 and pl.L, 53; E. Kühnert-Eggebrecht, Die Axt als Waffe und Werkzeug im Alten Ägypten' (Berlin, 1969), 98, B-I/6 and pl.V, 3. For parallels, see E. Kühnert-Eggebrecht, Die Axt als Waffe und Werkzeug im Alten Ägypten' (Berlin, 1969), 98 and references.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (4)
